text: John Bowman Thomas (July 14, 1925 – September 13, 2018)John Bowman Thomas was a noted American electrical engineer, educator, and a professor at Princeton University. He received his Ph.D. from Stanford University in 1955. He was the adviser of numerous outstanding scientists including Vincent Poor, Jack Wolf, Abraham H. Haddad, Dag Tjøstheim, Hisashi Kobayashi, and Eugene Wong. His PhD adviser was Willis W. Harman, a President of IONS. == Notes == Category:1925 births Category:American electrical engineers Category:Stanford University School of Engineering alumni Category:Princeton University faculty Category:2018 deaths
